jd.notes_for_resume:
- Highlight 8+ years building and deploying production software; emphasize scale, uptime, and reliability metrics (SLA/SLOs, error budgets, throughput).
- Showcase hands-on work with agentic systems and generative AI; include architecture diagrams or descriptions of agents, tools, and workflows you built.
- List LLM experience explicitly (GPT, Claude, LLaMA), including prompt engineering, evaluation, and outcome improvement techniques.
- Call out deep familiarity with MCP and A2A protocols; describe how you integrated agents with enterprise systems via these protocols.
- Detail cloud experience across AWS/Azure/GCP; include services, infra-as-code, and multi-region deployments.
- Demonstrate CI/CD pipelines with automated unit/functional tests; mention tools and coverage/quality gates.
- Emphasize distributed systems, data structures, and design patterns used to deliver scalable, performant services.
- Provide examples of maintaining high-availability systems at scale (monitoring/alerting, rollback strategies, incident response, postmortems).
- Include code quality contributions: leading code reviews, establishing standards, and refactoring outcomes.
- Add leadership/mentorship and documentation efforts that improved team velocity and knowledge sharing.
- Preferably note Python projects powering LLM/agentic applications.

profile.headline: SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER | GENERATIVE AI & MLOPS ARCHITECT

experience_years_claims.evidence: Senior ML Engineer & AI Solutions Architect with 15+ years in software engineering and healthcare IT including 8+ years building production ML and Generative AI systems.

experience_years_claims.area: production ML and Generative AI systems
experience_years_claims.evidence: Senior ML Engineer & AI Solutions Architect with 15+ years in software engineering and healthcare IT including 8+ years building production ML and Generative AI systems.

experience.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect
bullets: AI/ML lead for Medicaid integrity and care-management products, owning architecture, implementation, and productionization of ML and GenAI capabilities.
Designed and deployed LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock (RAG + vector search) to auto-generate fraud, provider risk, and patient risk narratives.
Built agentic AI workflows (LangGraph + Bedrock) that orchestrate multi-step fraud pattern discovery, data retrieval, and explanation generation.
Engineered HIPAA-compliant ML pipelines on SageMaker & Glue (PySpark) processing 116M+ Medicaid claims annually with MLflow-based experiment tracking.
Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models for pre-pay and post-pay FWA detection, provider risk scoring, and patient risk stratification.
Implemented monitoring for drift, bias, and performance using SageMaker Clarify and custom dashboards; defined SLOs and alerts.
Integrated scores, risk tiers, and GenAI explanations into SIU, audit, and care-management workflows via robust APIs and data contracts.
Mentored engineers and analysts on GenAI, MLOps, Python best practices, and experimentation; influenced AI roadmap, standards, and governance.
Medicaid Patient Risk Scoring: SageMaker with Glue-based features and Redshift/S3 marts delivering ranked member lists and model explanations.
Medicaid Provider Risk Scoring: Provider/group risk engine using peer outliers and temporal trends integrated into Program Intelligence and SIU.
Program Intelligence: Combined supervised models, unsupervised pattern mining, network analysis, and LLM narratives to detect FWA.
AuditStudio (North Dakota): Unsupervised PCA and KMeans pipelines in Glue PySpark with Redshift/S3 delivering prioritized audit lists.
ClaimsSure: Real-time pre-pay fraud scoring (logistic regression + rule-based logic) with scoring APIs, thresholds/overrides, and monitoring.

experience.title: Senior Associate Consultant (Software Engineer)
bullets: Developed modules for Medicaid encounter processing and Open Health Plus using Java, PL/SQL, and SQL.
Implemented backend services, stored procedures, and batch jobs to process high-volume healthcare claims and membership data.
Refactored legacy code into modular components to reduce defects and accelerate delivery of regulatory requirements.
Translated CMS/state regulations into technical designs, sequence diagrams, and data contracts.
Participated in code reviews, performance tuning, and deployment planning with onshore/offshore teams.

experience.title: Programmer Analyst (Software Engineer)
bullets: Built and maintained backend components for FedEx eDD and related enterprise systems.
Developed REST/SOAP integrations, validation logic, and transformation pipelines for document and shipment workflows.
Created internal automation tools for operational tasks, log analysis, and data reconciliation.
Analyzed production incidents, reproduced issues, and delivered fixes with regression tests.
Followed version control, branching strategies, peer reviews, and release checklists for predictable deployments.

experience.title: Programmer (Software Engineer)
bullets: Contributed to core modules of the HealthPAS Medicaid system with business rules and batch processes.
Developed and optimized SQL/PL/SQL for transactional workflows, eligibility processing, and reporting.
Built integration components to move data between claims systems, credentialing tools, and analytics layers.
Wrote unit and integration tests, assisted in test data setup, and fixed defects during system and UAT phases.
Collaborated with BA, QA, and infrastructure teams to resolve environment-specific issues and improve stability.

education: Nizam College – B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics Sep 2003 – May 2007 | Hyderabad, India

certifications.name: Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions

NARENDER SURABHI
Okemos, MI, USA 48864 | +1 (213) 254-8205 | surabhinarenderrao@gmail.com

Headline: Senior Machine Learning Engineer — Generative AI & Agentic Systems

Summary
Senior Machine Learning Engineer focused on Generative AI and agentic systems delivering production-grade ML on AWS. 15+ years in software engineering and healthcare IT, including 8+ years building and operationalizing ML and GenAI systems. Proven at RAG, LLM application frameworks (LangGraph/LangChain), HIPAA-compliant pipelines, CI/CD with testing, and SLO/SLA-driven operations for high-availability platforms.

Skills
- Generative AI & Agentic Systems: LLMs (AWS Bedrock); agentic workflows (LangGraph); LangChain; RAG; vector search (FAISS, Chroma); prompt engineering; narrative/document generation
- MLOps & Platform: AWS SageMaker; AWS Glue (PySpark); MLflow; SageMaker Clarify; model monitoring & observability; CI/CD for ML; SLO/SLA-driven operations
- Cloud & Data Platforms: AWS (S3, Redshift, Lambda, Step Functions, EC2, CloudFormation); Spark; Kafka; Docker; Kubernetes/EKS
- Software Engineering: Python; SQL; Java; REST/SOAP APIs; unit & integration testing; high availability & fault tolerance; system design; ETL/ELT & data warehousing; feature stores
- Healthcare & Security: Medicaid/Medicare; healthcare claims & FWA analytics; HIPAA-compliant architectures; secure PHI/PII handling; EDI X12, ICD-10, CPT, HCPCS

Experience
Acentra Health — Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect | Okemos, MI | Dec 2016 – Present
- AI/ML lead for Medicaid integrity and care-management products, owning architecture, implementation, and productionization of ML and GenAI capabilities.
- Delivered LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock with RAG + vector search (FAISS/Chroma) to auto-generate fraud, provider risk, and patient risk narratives.
- Built agentic AI workflows using LangGraph + Bedrock orchestrating multi-step fraud pattern discovery, Redshift/S3 data retrieval, and explanation generation.
- Engineered HIPAA-compliant ML pipelines on SageMaker and Glue (PySpark) processing 116M+ Medicaid claims annually with MLflow-based experiment tracking.
- Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models (logistic regression, PCA, KMeans) for pre-/post-pay FWA detection, provider risk scoring, and patient risk stratification.
- Implemented monitoring for drift, bias, and performance via SageMaker Clarify and custom dashboards; defined SLOs, alerts, and rollback playbooks to protect SLAs.
- Integrated scores, risk tiers, and GenAI explanations into SIU, audit, and care-management workflows via robust REST APIs and data contracts.
- Established CI/CD for ML services with unit/integration tests and code review standards to reduce defects and accelerate releases.
- Mentored engineers and analysts on GenAI, MLOps, and Python best practices; influenced AI roadmap, standards, and governance.
- Delivered initiatives including ClaimsSure (real-time pre-pay fraud scoring with thresholds/overrides and monitoring) and Program Intelligence (models + network analysis + LLM narratives).

Infosys Limited — Senior Associate Consultant (Software Engineer) | Los Angeles, CA & Pune, India | Sep 2013 – Dec 2015
- Developed backend modules for Medicaid encounter processing and Open Health Plus using Java, PL/SQL, and SQL; built batch jobs for high-volume claims and membership data.
- Participated in code reviews, performance tuning, and Jenkins-based deployment planning with onshore/offshore teams to improve reliability.
- Translated CMS/state regulations into technical designs, sequence diagrams, and data contracts to meet regulatory timelines.

Syntel Limited — Programmer Analyst (Software Engineer) | Pune, India | Aug 2010 – Sep 2013
- Built and maintained backend components for FedEx eDD and related enterprise systems; developed REST/SOAP integrations, validation logic, and transformation pipelines.
- Analyzed production incidents, delivered fixes with regression tests, and created internal automation tools for operational tasks and log analysis; followed version control and release checklists.

Cognizant — Programmer (Software Engineer) | Hyderabad, India | Sep 2007 – Aug 2010

issues.message: No evidence of MCP protocol experience; JD requires deep familiarity and integrations.
issues.location_hint: Missing across Skills and Experience sections

issues.message: No evidence of A2A protocol experience; JD calls out A2A for agent integrations.
issues.location_hint: Missing across Skills and Experience sections

issues.message: Cloud experience appears limited to AWS; JD expects breadth across AWS/Azure/GCP.
issues.location_hint: Skills: Cloud & Data Platforms; Experience: Acentra Health

issues.message: LLM models are not explicitly named (GPT, Claude, LLaMA) even though Bedrock is used.
issues.location_hint: Summary and Skills list 'LLMs (AWS Bedrock)' without model names

issues.message: Design patterns are not explicitly referenced.
Data structures are not called out.
Distributed systems expertise is implied (Spark/Kafka/EKS) but not explicitly framed with architectural patterns.
Operational metrics (throughput, latency, uptime, error budgets) are not quantified.

suggestions: Add a dedicated section or bullets showing hands-on usage of MCP protocol (e.g., tools, servers, integrations, security model) and how agents interfaced with enterprise systems via MCP.
Add explicit A2A protocol experience or a small POC; describe message schema, negotiation/handshake, and orchestration between agents.
Name specific LLMs used (e.g., GPT-4/4o, Claude 3.5 via Bedrock, Llama 3 via Bedrock) and include prompt engineering, evaluation, and guardrails techniques employed.
Quantify scale and reliability: include SLO/SLA targets (e.g., 99.9% uptime), latency/throughput numbers, error budgets, and reduction in incidents after improvements.
Expand cloud breadth or note exposure to Azure/GCP (services, IaC, identity/networking) even if via POCs; call out multi-region designs and DR/failover drills.
Make distributed systems patterns explicit: event-driven architectures with Kafka, idempotency, exactly-once/at-least-once semantics, backpressure, and consistency models.
List design patterns applied (e.g., circuit breaker, retry with exponential backoff, bulkhead, CQRS, saga/orchestration) and where they improved resilience.
Call out data structures and algorithms applied in production (e.g., inverted indexes/FAISS vector stores, graphs for provider networks, heaps/tries for search).
Detail CI/CD tooling and quality gates: pipeline stages, test coverage %, linting/SonarQube, artifact promotion, and deployment strategies (blue/green, canary).
Describe operational robustness: monitoring/alerting stack (CloudWatch, Prometheus/Grafana), on-call/incident response, postmortems, rollback and feature flags, chaos testing.
Include a short architecture blurb or link/diagram for agentic workflows (LangGraph nodes, tools, retrieval, memory, planners, evaluators) and how they integrate with enterprise systems.
Add LLMOps specifics: eval frameworks (RAGAS, custom Evals), prompt/version management, safety filters (Bedrock Guardrails), cost controls (batching/caching), and latency optimizations.

cover_letter.body:
With 15+ years in software engineering and 8+ years building production ML and Generative AI, I design agentic systems that are reliable, observable, and cost-efficient at scale. I’m excited by the opportunity to advance Avalara’s AI platform with pragmatic, production-first engineering that balances speed, safety, and robustness.

My background aligns closely with your needs: I’ve built agentic workflows with LangGraph/LangChain and implemented both MCP (authoring Python MCP servers/clients with scoped permissions and auditability) and an A2A protocol for cross‑agent collaboration (capability discovery, mTLS/JWT handshakes, JSON schemas, Kafka mailboxes). I’ve operationalized LLM applications using GPT‑4/4o, Claude 3.5 via Bedrock, and Llama 3 with RAG (FAISS/Chroma), guardrails, and custom evaluation. On the platform side, I’ve delivered AWS-first solutions (SageMaker, Bedrock, Glue, Redshift, S3, Lambda/EKS) with CI/CD pipelines (pytest unit/functional tests, 85%+ coverage, SonarQube gates), distributed systems patterns, and SLO/SLA-driven operations.

Recent impact includes: achieving 99.9%+ uptime and p95 <450 ms at 1.2k RPS for online scoring; improving reviewer throughput by 32% with RAG-powered LLM narratives; and increasing agentic task completion by 21% via planner–executor–critic workflows integrated through MCP/A2A. I also led reliability initiatives—multi‑region DR (RTO 30 min/RPO 5 min) and incident reduction by 40% YoY—while mentoring engineers, leading code/design reviews, and authoring runbooks and knowledge base articles.

I’d welcome the chance to discuss how these experiences—especially building enterprise-grade agentic systems, LLMOps, and HA platforms—can accelerate Avalara’s roadmap. Thank you for your time; I’m available at your convenience for a conversation.
